xyz.acygn.mokapot

Class MethodMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.acygn.mokapot.MethodMessage

  • public class MethodMessage
extends Object
    A message which tells the recipient system to run a specified method. This can be used both for static methods, and for object methods. The parameters should not have been explicitly marshalled; they'll be marshalled along with the message as a whole.

    Classes are identified via Class objects (which will presumably be serialised in the standard Java way when the MethodMessage is marshalled). It is advised to ensure that the sender and recipient are using identical classpaths, in order to avoid a misunderstanding between the two systems about what a class is called.

    Note that in order to allow changes to the details of classes to be made, methods are identified not via Method objects, but via their name, parameters and declaring class.

    Author:
    Alex Smith

      • calculateReply

        public Object calculateReply()
                      throws Throwable
        Invokes the method, and sends the results back to the original system via the given communicator.
        Returns:
        The return value of the method.
        Throws:
        Throwable - If an exception occurs running the method, this throws that exception.

      • process

        public void process(xyz.acygn.mokapot.MessageAddress returnAddress)
        Runs code specific to this message, then sends the corresponding reply back to the original system.
        Parameters:

      • sendsReply

        public boolean sendsReply()
        Always returns true. Messages implemented using this class send a reply by definition.
        Returns:
        true.

      • lightweightSafe

        public boolean lightweightSafe()
        Always returns false. A message that requires a reply cannot be lightweight.
        Returns:
        false.

      • safeStringify

        public static String safeStringify(Object o)
        Creates a string representation of the given object, without triggering network calls. Used to prevent recursive network calls in the debug code.
        Parameters:
        o - The object to produce a string representation of.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the object, using local information.

      • standinStringify

        public static <T> String standinStringify(Standin<T> standin)
        Creates a string representation of a standin with remote data storage, without network access. Split out from safeStringify due to limitations of Java's type system.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the standin's referent.
        Parameters:
        standin - The standin to stringify.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the standin.
